data.text: For an app that wants to help you save money, it can do that for a VERY expensive price. I signed up through a referral link from a creator to get a week free trial, and after the week is up I got charged the annual price of the "monthly subscription" that you chose to pay. Good thing I lowered it from $10 a month default to $4 because I would've been out $120 immediately which not everyone can afford. Would not recommend this app until they charge you monthly like expected. I feel lied to.
data.replyText:
Hey Cam, happy to share our paid plan is optional!

It sounds like you intended to select our monthly plan, but opted to pay for your membership annually. Not to worry, our support team can refund and correct that for you if you'd like.

They can be reached either through the in app chat or by sending an email to support@rocketmoney.com


Thanks!

data.text: Does not let me cancel some subscriptions I'd like to cancel. The option just simply isn't there. Apparently I'm paying for Netflix twice somehow and it's listed as A2A, but when I click the 3 dots on it, there is no option to cancel the subscription. And the chat for customer service is a joke. Can't actually chat for help. You can only select from a list of options.
data.replyText:
Hi Ryan,

While we cancel many subscriptions, there are some companies that do not allow us to cancel on your behalf. In these cases, we provide the instructions so you're able to cancel.

That said, we do not believe you should pay for premium. Please reach out to us at support@rocketmoney.com and we'll refund it!

Thanks so much!

data.text: Good money management and budgeting app. Love being able to see all my balances in one place and track recurring bills, however, could be better with biller connections for real due dates and amounts instead of projections based on past transactions, like Mint and Prism used to have. I think that Intuit is a big enough company to make this happen if a smaller app like prism could do it. Rocket has better monetization than mint or prism did and that feature would make me want to pay for premium.

As a retiree, I found Rocket Money helpful and it provides much understanding of my financial status. Everything I need to monitor is at my finger tips. I am kept informed of all activities prior to the transaction occurring. Easy transition between transactions and net worth. I find it easy to use and educational. I love it! ‚ù§Ô∏èüëç

It is super easy to use and I started saving money right from the start. I was able to open up a savings account and have what I save transfer in there . I used to just look at my statement online, never really questioning everything. Rocket money has me looking at my account and my transactions without all the stress and confusion. Knowing my money better helps me to save my money better. I really do love it!

Rocket Money is an incredibly user-friendly app with a sleek interface that makes navigation a breeze. Not only is it easy to use, but it also provides highly accurate financial data to help you stay on top of your finances. Whether you're tracking expenses, setting budgets, or managing investments, Rocket Money is there to assist you every step of the way. Give it a try and experience the convenience and efficiency for yourself!

3 accounts stay in delayed status unless I relink them and I'm premium (retirement, student loans, now checkings). Not compatible with connecting Fidelity so I add the transactions. I don't like the Goals feature because Rocket wants to do the transfers on your behalf but I already have that set up automatically through an existing account, I don't need a new savings account from Rocket. I just want it to track when that account reaches its goal based on the money I don't spend each month.
data.replyText:
Hi Sookie,

DJ from Rocket Money here! Thanks for raising this to our attention! I'll be happy to look into this for you and make it right!

Please email me at support@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: I've been using this app for about 2 weeks. It has helped me to feel more informed and confident about where my money is going. I can see trends and spending habits. I love the categories! I sent one bill to be renegotiated, and I am still waiting to hear back. The partnership services that are integrated into the app need to be more transparent. They are presented as if they are part of the rocket money app and will sync with the same information, but that is not always the case.

Decent once it updates, but the account sync is horrible. Always have to manually sync, then the interface can't update itself. You literally have to force close the app and open again to see updated balances. Notifications also seem to only happen when you open the app, super helpful... Needs a lot of work.
data.replyText:
Hi Tam,

DJ from Rocket Money here! So sorry for the inconvenience! It sounds like our linking provider is having an issue with your bank. I'll be happy to look into this for you as well as refund your premium charge.

Please email me at support@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: It doesn't seem to support Fidelity Investments which is quite a common 401k provider. Makes the app pretty useless for me since that's where I have all my investments. Also, the interfacea to add new accounts aren't super intuitive - it seems to assume you only have 1 bank per type of account (investments, savings, etc.) which isn't the case for many people.
data.replyText:
Hi Samantha,

DJ from Rocket Money here! We are currently working to restore connectivity to Fidelity, so sorry for the inconvenience!

I'd be happy to send some instructions over on how to add in additional accounts, please email me at support@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: The bill tracking isn't good. Sometimes my bills will drop off or fall out of place. Leaving me to not trust it. Another missed payment last night. $28 fee it dropped off the list. When I pay each bill, in recurring , I mark as paid. Am I doing this wrong? To inconsistent.
data.replyText:
Hi Monica,

DJ from Rocket Money here! Thanks for raising this to our attention! I'll be happy to look into this for you and make it right!

Please email me at support@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: Took me about 30 minutes to set everything up. I honestly like rocket money as it is very easy to see my bank account balance/ incoming paychecks/ bills. I don't really understand the budget aspect. Some how I have spent $2891 this month but I only make $2500 and still have $900 set aside. I think it'll reset and be more accurate next month. I tried the auto lower my bill feature. Hasn't worked yet but I think that's because I am a frugal subscriber.

This is a great app for managing money. I really like the overview it provides across accounts. I primarily use it for the budgeting feature, which leads me to my one critique. It's really odd to me that a budgeting app doesn't allow you to plan or individualize next month's budget in advance, when the whole point of budgeting is to be able to plan ahead! I can't see or adjust February's budget even though it is only a few days away now. This is a really important feature I hope to see soon.

My accounts won't sync even after relinking the account. I don't want to unlink and relink my accounts every time I log in. I am looking for a different app with better functionality. Please fix this! If the account syncing wasn't an issue, it would be a fantastic app! Great charts to keep you on track, and it's visually appealing. It's relatively user-friendly. I like that it tells you how much you can spend per day for the rest of the month.
data.replyText:
Hi there,

DJ from Rocket Money here! So sorry for the inconvenience! It sounds like our linking provider is having an issue with your bank. I'll be happy to look into this for you as well as refund your premium charge.

Please email me at support@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: Rocket Money is a great application to combine all your bills and money accounts to track and set up a budget or just track where your money goes! You absolutely need no experience because the interface makes it easy to use! They even make it easy to cancel unwanted subscriptions and they negotiate lower payments for some of your bills!!! The free version is great and you can name your own price for the full version!!!

Great in functionality, with a couple of things... the app has been really slow lately, taking several seconds sometimes between me pressing a button and it taking action. Scrolling is laggy, too. I have an old iPhone that the app runs way more smoothly on right now. The other thing... would LOVE to get dark mode!! My eyes could use it at night.
data.replyText:
We always appreciate user feedback Travis,

If you are having difficulty with the app or have feature requests, please contact our support team!

They can be reached either through the in app chat or by sending an email to support@rocketmoney.com.

Thanks!

data.text: This app has replaced my physical budget notebook. I love the calendar especially paycheck view. Budgets are highly customizable. I love the dashboard that shows credit score, net cash, and debt. I have not set up a savings goal yet but there are so many features to try in this app. I used YNAB for a year and could not stay consistent. Full disclosure: I get the premium version for free for being a Rocket Mortgage customer but I'd be willing to pay. I use this app daily.

Premium def. with the low monthly cost! I love that I can share this with my wife so she can access the same data from her phone. Web access from a computer is also great! My only complaint is that there's a little bit of a learning curve. IE sometimes recurring transactions don't show show up as a "bill", and sometimes transactions that shouldn't be marked as a bill, such as stopping for gas at the same gas station DOES get listed as a bill. Also, PLEASE add dark mode to the app!

Bill Tracker is misleading and inaccurate. It evaluates your spending to determine monthly bills, instead of logging into the biller directly to give you accurate amounts and true due dates. For example, if you pay $5 every month for a subscription it lists a $5 monthly bill for that service, so if that amount increases you won't know until the next billing cycle hits your bank account = you will miss surprise fees and any changes to billing dates.
data.replyText:
Hi there,

DJ from Rocket Money here! Thanks for raising this to our attention! I'll be happy to look into this for you and make it right!

Please email me at DJ@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: It feels counterintuitive to purchase something to help you manage how much you're spending, but after years of either using an Excel sheet or just straight up not having a budget tracker, this has become so helpful. I get alerted to weird purchases, I get to see exactly how much I have left to spend per day for the month, and I can set solid goals for myself that are shown to not be too hard to reach, I just needed it all laid out.

I bought some music on Bandcamp for ¬•1500 which is around $10. Then, I checked my email and I got a big warning about a large transaction of $1590! I kinda freaked out for a second, until I figured out that it was supposed to be yen. In general though, the app doesn't fit my style of budgeting. I just want 1 budget category and then to easily take stuff off. I don't want to have to go in and click ignore on medicine, textbooks, etc. So, I would like an easier way to take stuff off the budget.
data.replyText:
Hi there,

DJ from Rocket Money here! Thanks for raising this to our attention! I'd love to hear more about this and offer you a free month of Premium!

Please email me at support@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: I don't understand the appeal of this app. It doesn't do all financial institutions and they commonly can't lower your bills. Might be useful for people trying to budget but I didn't need help with that before I downloaded. The only features I care about require premium and they don't work so I'm not sure I'll be keeping this on my phone much longer. Edit - the one feature I liked was being able to have one spot to see all my different accounts but it's locked behind premium. Save your money.
data.replyText:
Hi there,

Thanks for reaching out, sorry to hear your experience hasn't been great!

It sounds like our linking provider is having issues with your bank. Additionally, some companies don't allow us to cancel on your behalf.

Please email support@rocketmoney.com and we'll be happy to assist further!

data.text: After a decade with Mint I have switched to Rocket. I like the visuals but It could have been better with a rolling budget function. The biggest issue is the sync problem. It doesn't reflect the net worth accurately and doesn't sync even if it states that it did. Needs urgent solution otherwise noone will be using it if the transactions doesn't sync.
data.replyText:
Hi Tolga,

DJ from Rocket Money here! So sorry for the inconvenience! It sounds like our linking provider is having an issue with your bank. I'll be happy to look into this for you as well as refund your premium charge.

Please email me at support@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: The app is just another bill you don't need. It's not user friendly as far as it's layout. And it is Not as easy as it looks on TV to find recurring payments you need to get rid of...the amount of info the app needs to contact a bill..you might as well have called them yourself. This app does Not make budgeting any easier. It's a waste of money.
data.replyText:
Hi there,

Thanks for reaching out to us and sorry to hear that your experience hasn't been great!

Happy to see what we can do to improve your experience with Rocket Money.

Please email DJ@rocketmoney.com and we'll be happy to assist you further.

Thanks so much!

data.text: Fantastic app that makes it super easy to understand your spending. They let my partner use it at no extra charge. It's easy to link your various credit card, stock trading and banking accounts. They let you choose what to pay for their premium version and have saved me over $400 by renegotiating my cable bill! They take a cut of what I saved, but let me pay this over 6 months WITH NO INTEREST! Rocket Money is the best!

If you're looking for a Mint replacement THIS IS IT. Waaay better then Credit Karma. It's much all the feature of Mint , but better looking, cleaner, more reliable, and has a few cool features, like canceling subscriptions right from the app. There is a subscription fee eventually (free if your a Rocket Mortgage customer), but there's no ads, and no selling your data. Only complaint, I really miss the Android widgets from Mint. Nice to have your info on the home screen.

App is a ripoff. It doesn't work for all cancellation services and the bill negotiation fee is 30 to 60% with 1 year paid UPFRONT which is way too high in my opinion. In addition they charge a monthly Subscription fee to use most of the features. Pretty hypocritical when the point of using the apps is to get rid of Subscriptions and spend less money!
data.replyText:
Hi Craig,

Apologies for any confusion, this is a free app, but we do offer optional features that are paid. The features take real labor on our team members. The same goes for our negotiations which are labor intensive. If this weren't the case, we would provide it free!

For any questions, please email me at support@rocketmoney.com. Thanks!

data.text: For a financial and budget app, it is quite disappointing. If you want something as basic as your net worth, adding up your already linked accounts, you have to pay for a premium subscription. Want your current info? Pay for premium. Want your money added together? Pay for premium. What a way to nickel and dime people who are trying to budget. Now you have to budget for the basics of a budgeting app.
data.replyText:
Hi Shelby,

DJ from Rocket Money here! I'm so sorry for the frustration, but we do provide quite a few features, including the ability to link accounts and budget, in our free version. I'd love to help you take full advantage of our app!

Please email me at support@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: I love having this budgeting app, when they changed from true bill I was a tad hesitant. But they've done a good job maintaining the ease of use. I went from keeping my finances on a spreadsheet to being able to manage them directly from these apps. The credit check is awesome and keeps everything together.

When I first got the app, I selected the $5 a month plan for myself to use their premium features. The first thing I did was cancel my membership from a resume builder that I used as a one time purchase. Not only was I charged $60 a month for the Rocket money subscription, they never canceled my membership with the resume builder people, so I was also charged $25 for them. Only useful thing it's done so far was show my upcoming bills, but it doesn't include when free trials end.
data.replyText:
Hi Lilliana,

DJ from Rocket Money here! It sounds like for an annual premium subscription, when you wanted monthly! I'd love to refund this as well as assist with your subscription cancellation experience.

Please email me at support@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: I mainly downloaded and paid for a monthly subscription with one of the reasons being Rocket Money advertised they find monthly subscriptions you may have forgot about and they cancel that subscription for you. I work many hours per week and canceling subscriptions consumes time that I just don't have. I attempted to cancel one and was given information on how to proceed with canceling it (which I already knew how to). I manage my finances by paper so A+ for saving me time with that.
data.replyText:
Hi there,

While we cancel many subscriptions, there are some companies that do not allow us to cancel on your behalf. In these cases, we provide the instructions so you're able to cancel.

That said, we do not believe you should pay for premium. Please reach out to us at DJ@rocketmoney.com and I'll refund it!

Thanks so much!

data.text: Love this app! Finally an all-encompassing finance app for consumers! I have been looking for an app like this for years. You can track your spending across all your accounts, review credit card and loan balances, set a budget, and even export your data! Very low cost. Highly recommend. *update: I wish you could add hierarchy to rules or additional variables (e.g., if transaction has no existing rule, update category to "review").

Love having everything in one place. I have just started with the app, but it has already made me more efficient with my budgeting time and opening up areas of budget planning I hadn't made time for. It has been awesome to help me organize, manage, itemize, and plan. I haven't even used half of the features yet, and it is really user-friendly.

I know this is a small thing, but the fact that it doesnt turn landscape is a horriblu UI decision to make, mow i have to hold my Tablet instead of being able to dock it on my keyboard. This is the opposite of its ultimate function of providing a more convenient experience, pretty sure i am canceling my account. My excel spreadsheet is more useful
data.replyText:
Hi Scott,

DJ from Rocket Money here! Thanks for raising this to our attention! I'd love to hear more about this suggestion and pass it along to our Product team and offer you a free month of Premium!

Please email me at support@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: A bit annoying that you can't use the basic features until you give it access to your bank or credit cards.. I just wanted to try out the budgeting features and learn how the lower my bills part works.. I don't want to give you access to track everything I do. No thanks.
data.replyText:
Sorry for any confusion or disappointment Jacob,

Rocket Money works by linking and analyzing your financial accounts then building your budget around that!

If you have any questions, issues, or concerns with getting started, please reach out to our support team. They can be reached through the in app chat or by emailing support@rocketmoney.com.

data.text: Doesn't actually allow you to cancel memberships as advertised. I've only been able to do that once. It's extremely limited. Might as well use your bank app for transaction history and cancel memberships through your bank or through the membership company. This app is pointless and not worth paying for.
data.replyText:
Hi Sarah,

DJ from Rocket Money here! Unfortunately, there are some companies that do not allow us to cancel on your behalf. In these cases, we provide the instructions so you're able to cancel.

That said, we do not believe you should pay for premium. Please reach out to me at support@rocketmoney.com and I'll refund it!

Thanks so much!

data.text: Sure, there's a lag time between price increases and subscriptions you may have turned off, etc., not that big of a deal. This app allows for you to choose your pricing for monthly subscription to their app, they have a free option as well. Overall, it's a pretty good app if you're willing to put in some work long side it to balance your budget. This app makes it a hell of a lot easier.

Ok for visualizing my spend but i did sign up for premium with the hopes that they could take care of cancelling my subscriptions and lowering bills. When I selected to lower my phone bill, the app instructed me to look to other providers rather than what I thought they would do and call to negotiate on my behalf. Of the three subscriptions I wanted to cancel, 1 I was directly told in the app to do myself. The other two I had to wait about 10 days to get an email saying to do it myself.
data.replyText:
Hi Desiree,

Thanks for reaching out! We'll be happy to take a look at this and assist you further as well as refund your Premium charge!

Please email us at support@rocketmoney.com and we'll get right on this!

Thanks so much!

data.text: It's a great concept and I think the layout is better than comparable apps such as Mint. Problem is the connectivity of other banks (such as PNC) and the overall app buggy-ness. App often freezes or just closes on its own too much; almost makes it unusable at times. Also, the feature of them lowering our bills is kinda sketchy. They ask for your personal info to access your account for respective bill and one bill they said they lowered but I have yet to see it in my statements.
data.replyText:
Hi Andrew,

So sorry for the inconvenience! The freezing is currently under investigation. We hope to have a fix soon, but until then, we'll be happy to provide you with a free month of premium or refund your most recent premium charge.

Please email support@rocketmoney.com and we'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: Update 1/14: able to resolve most of the issues post login. Even though they use plaid, they have a number of institutions that are disconnected even though other apps using plaid have connected to those institutions (Monarch money). I think this is a step up from mint and definitely a much better user experience. Minus 1 star for limited banks. Switching from Mint. Downloaded the app but cant sign up for an account. Cant get past the password screen. Good luck to everyone who got it to work.
data.replyText:
Hi Vishal,

DJ from Rocket Money here! So sorry for the frustration! I'll be happy to look into this for you and make it right!

Please email me at DJ@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: It's quite decent at a money app, however after a while they stop syncing your data. Mine hasn't been synced in over a month. They lock some features behind a paywall, which is fair as they are a company trying to profit. Certainly a 5 star app if you fix the syncing issues. I find the subscriptions tab to be particularly useful as I'm not the best with managing them.
data.replyText:
Sorry to hear that Ryan,

Our support team should be able to take a closer look into your account syncing issues free of charge.

They can be reached either through the in app chat or by sending an email to support@rocketmoney.com.

Thanks!

data.text: I use to use mint for monitoring spendings. But forced to migrate to credit karma, then I realize how BAD credit karma do on Spending categorization, monitoring and plotting. So I start to looking for alternatives, And this app is exactly what I'm looking for: üôÇ with the spending history tracking, customization, and overall view of where your money goes in selected periode. Great App! Definitely recommended for previous mint user who might still suffer/struggle with Credit Karmaüòî

Really powerful app (with web browser interface to use with my laptop) to manage my spending, budgeting, finances, etc. The free version is already powerful, and I'm now spending just $4/month for even more features (e.g. custom budget categories and spending goals). Highly recommend, especially if you're jumping ship from Mint

I can't live without this app. You don't have to pay for the subscription, it takes all my information from credit and debit and adds it into one budget so I'm not spending any money I don't have on my credit card. It's amazing. There was a period in which my account was down and I was scrambling all over trying to get it back up and running because I can't handle my finances without using this app. The subscription gives you extra fancy things like specific categories, but I'm fine without it.

I got this app to see what a purchase on my card was that I did not recognize. After setting up my account it instantly told me what subscription it was under the right name. Not only that I was impressed to see all the different things u can do on here like starting savings and telling u when u paid bills. This app is very well set up and is definitely worth it!

Omg! I just downloaded this because I need help and the reviews where great and soon I go to add both my first premier bank credit cards it's saying credentials of username and password are wrong when they are not!! I literally just downloaded this and already an issue!!! I'm about to take off and look for another app if this. Can't get resolved ASAP extremely frustrating! üòî
data.replyText:
Hi Christina,

DJ from Rocket Money here! So sorry for the inconvenience! It sounds like our linking provider is having an issue with your bank. I'll be happy to look into this for you.

Please email me at DJ@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: I've been using Rocket Money for a while now, and it's become an essential tool in managing my finances. This app makes tracking expenses and budgeting incredibly easy. I love how its User-Friendly. Rocket Money has an intuitive interface that I can navigate effortlessly. It's so straightforward to add transactions and see where my money is going. The app provides detailed insights into my spending habits. I can visualize my expenses by category and track my income. Loving it now!!

There are many things to love about this app, but I really wish they offered "roll-over" spending, so you could better track what could spend on travel or other events you save for over time. Besides that, it's overall a great app! Offers networth feedback, credit tracking, etc.

As a previous Mint user, I think Rocket Money is way better. They saved me $30 off my Verizon bill and find things that are on monthly payments that I forgot about by going through the account ledger and seeing a pattern of monthly bills and alerting you. Visually pleasing and easy to use. Thanks to Rocket app credit report, I quickly saw that my oldest cc was no longer open and was able to quickly call them with number Rocket money provided and got my oldest account reactivated.

In just a few days times, Rocket Money has helped me lower my monthly expenses several hundred dollars. I have made some sacrifices doing so, but it was ultimately worth it. I canceled some subscriptions and services I wasn't using but was still paying for. Definitely a helpful resource to use to help eliminate some monthly expenses.

Love the features but it's still very buggy and glitchy. Active subscriptions keep getting moved to inactive subscriptions for seemingly no reason, which is very inconvenient for bill tracking. I've talked to customer service and reported the bug but they haven't been able to figure it out yet unfortunately.
data.replyText:
Hi Kaitlin,

DJ from Rocket Money here! Thanks for raising this to our attention! I'll be happy to look into this for you and assist you further!

Please email me at DJ@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: Keeps dropping my Edward Jones account. It takes multiple attempts to reinstall it and then it lasts updating for several days until it drops it again. I don't know whether it's Edward Jones's problem or rockets problem but it's frustrating. Thanks DJ but for four bucks a month I went to quicken simplifi and everything works really well. I canceled my paid program and deleted my account
data.replyText:

data.text: I kept getting multiple charges per month and was only paying$3 mo was getting $10 and $24 and multiple $3 charges ea month. Kept trying to cancel it didn't even help I always had to cancel subscriptions myself anyways I finally got them to cancel the account completely then I recently found charges from them about a year later 3 different charges just like before and I have no acct I've lost so much money to this company I'm NOT HAPPY AT All!¬°!!!!!!!!!
data.replyText:

data.text: App has a lot of potential and I like the layout, but it doesn't sync with Fidelity or the Fidelity Rewards card. Unfortunately, this is a deal killer for me since I do all of my everyday spending on the Fidelity Rewards card, so budgeting is useless with rocket. They claim to be "working on it" but other apps work with Fidelity no problem, so I have to look elsewhere for an app to replace Mint.
data.replyText:

DJ from Rocket Money here! Thanks for raising this to our attention! We are working on adding Fidelity support back. We hope you'll give us another try when we do!

If you'd like to share more about your experience, email me at support@rocketmoney.com!

data.text: "UPDATE" Yea it was nice to see all of the transactions in one place and I don't care for on demand updates I just every so often but it never update the transactions from the first time I set everything up at the start, over a month and a half ago. Ok update they helped reset everything and since the reset it has been staying up to date. Thank you.
data.replyText:

DJ from Rocket Money here! Thanks for raising this to our attention! I'll be happy to look into this for you and make it right!

data.text: It used to be good, but lately it's never been letting me deposit into savings anymore. I would have 10x the amount in trying to deposit from my account, but it will stay giving me the same error saying I don't have sufficient funds to make the transfer, when that's just completely false and I can clearly see the bank linked has way more funds than what I'm trying to deposit. I don't know what's wrong with it, but I now have to leave the app since it's useless now. I only ever used it for saving
data.replyText:

data.text: This app is terrible. Can't actually get a response from the help or ask a question. Can't login most if the time, always and error on their end. You'd think they'd have better customers service. I can't even login to cancel the app or close the account. What a joke. No actual customer support, can't login, I guess if you aren't a premium member, you don't count as a customer.
data.replyText:
Very sorry to hear this Todd!

Our support team should be available to lend you a hand with your account regardless of membership status.

Please contact them either through the in app chat or by sending an email to support@rocketmoney.com.

Thanks!

data.text: Very easy to use and set up rules. The only thing I'd change is to allow setting a monthly income for like "the forth specified day of the month". I receive my social security check on the forth Wednesday every month and can't set it up to record the transaction that way. I'd appreciate your assistance with this matter. Sincerely, Ian Catto

This app doesn't update accounts. I have several account that haven't synced in over a year and when I try to sync them manually I'm prompted to sign up for a paid subscription. You need a subscription for them to cancel your subscriptions to other services. Not worth the money I'll do it myself. Deleting this app.
data.replyText:
Sorry to hear that Kurt,

Sounds like you may need some help with our linking partner Plaid! Getting those accounts updated does not require a Premium subscription.

Our support team should be able to lend a hand here. They can be reached through either our in app chat or by sending an email to support@rocketmoney.com.

Thanks!

data.text: I used to be a Mint user, I loved it so much- but when it merged with CK it became worthless. I went to rocket money and immediately discovered I had forgotten to cancel a subscription(not charged monthly so i didn't see it in statements) and helped me create a budget- and they are negotiating bills for me. Highly recommend

I thought this would be the Mint alternative, but nope. Half my accounts haven't worked for the past three weeks of the one month free trial. They're not even obscure accounts, they're well-know platforms. One of my accounts has never linked properly despite being listed as a supported integration. It was telling when they sent an email out apologizing for not being able to process refunds and account cancelations as fast as they're coming in. Their support staff is snarky and unhelpful.
data.replyText:
Hi there Dan,

Thanks for reaching out to us and sorry to hear that your experience hasn't been great!

Our team would be happy to see what we can do to improve your experience with Rocket Money.

Please email support@rocketmoney.com and we'll gladly assist you further.

Thanks so much!

data.text: Guys the rocket money app is crazy convenient. Found out I had 3 SEPARATE audible accounts I was subscribed too. 2 of them were from an old card that shouldn't have even been working anymore. Just tapped the cancel subscription button and it was taken care of in a couple days. I had spent like 1,300$ on those subscriptions and I had no idea. Rocket money also has options for creating a budget for yourself and can also negotiate the cost of alot of your bills. Just friggen check it out. 10/10

Currently I like the app. I do wish I would have known about it before years of Mint, just as thorough though. I do have syncing problems and I really wish the interface was not so consolidated .otherwise.. I like it. I think I'll definitely be able to get used to it quickly. We will see I guess once I get it set up
data.replyText:
Hi Laura,

Thanks for reaching out! We really appreciate your feedback here. I would love to hear more about your experience, help you with your syncing issue, and offer you a free month of Premium!

Please reach out to me at DJ@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this.

Thanks so much!

data.text: 1/9/24 UPDATE I recieved an email 12/26 to email DJ and he would look into my sign in problem. I emailed same day. I have yet to get any response. Im moving on! -Sign in loop Looking for Mint alternatives since it went away. Tried to create an account and the app says it found an existing account. I sign in and authenticate, but the app does nothing after that. So, I go back to the log in screen and try that route. It says I don't have an account. To say that is frustrating is an understatement!
data.replyText:
Hi Terry,

DJ from Rocket Money here! Thanks for raising this to our attention! I'll be happy to look into this for you and make it right!

Please email me at DJ@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: Very cool functionality, very useful! Only issues are that accounts lag on sync so they're not always up to date within last 24 hours and everytime I change apps and return to rocket I need to log in again. So maddening when I'm trying to look up a bill on another screen. Other than that a great app!

Decided to try this app out. Their system couldn't find 2 of my credit cards, so I decided to cancel it, as I was unable to utilize its features. I was then charged a random ammount 63.03 which caused my bank account to go into a negative spiral of bank fees the bank won't return. So now I'm out money I needed to get oil to heat my home. They refunded me as soon as I contacted them but it took over a week to get the money back. Worst experience with a "free trial" I've ever had. I'd stay clear.

Says I already have an account when I go to create account and when I go through the process of getting username and changing password when I got to log in it says my email/username is not in the system despite being sent multiple emails proving otherwise, have had this problem once before two years ago, figured it was a bug that was fixed nope just the app and it being messed up.
data.replyText:
Sorry to hear this Katherine!

Sounds like you may need some help getting logged back into your account. Our support team should be able to lend a hand here.

They can be reached through the in app chat or by sending an email to support@rocketmoney.com

Thanks

data.text: Rocket money is everything you'd want in a money management app. From seeing a quick overview of all your accounts including bank, cards, and loans, to viewing your credit, Rocket money has built an amazing app that I use almost daily. A new feature I found today is auto-saving with custom goals to make reaching an emergency fund or safety net effortless in the background.

Be very careful with this app. Please know that the free trial is not free. I was charged $40.66, and it was set to be a reoccurring fee. I never agreed to this luckily I saw it in time. The app provides you with false info to get you to try it, then takes money from your account. It stated that if you cancel your "free" trial before the end date, you wouldn't be charged however I was. I canceled in less than 24 hours; I had a feeling that the app was too good to be true and I was right.
data.replyText:
Hi Jacqueline,

DJ from Rocket Money here! It sounds like you signed up for our premium subscription without intending to. I'll be happy to get it refunded for you!

Please email me at DJ@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: My initial impression is 'Wow!' It's clean and easy to navigate. All my financial data is readily available up front. You're not bombarded with ads and credit cards. For my use case this is miles better than Mint was and infinitely better than NerdWallet. I might end up going premium because this has a lot to offer.

This app sucks! It never reminds me of upcoming bills, and when it does somehow its always telling me about unauthorized transactions, which is 100% incorrect. Not only that, but every bill it recognizes somehow gets duplicated 2-3 times on different days. It is very frustrating and very annoying and extremely unhelpful with inaccurate financial data.
data.replyText:
Hi Kade,

DJ from Rocket Money here! So sorry for the inconvenience! It sounds like our linking provider is having an issue with your bank. I'll be happy to look into this for you as well as provide you free premium for your trouble!

Please email me at support@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: This app doesn't let you know it cost money to use until AFTER you have given access to your bank account! You're given the option to pick what you want to pay $0, $4, or $10 a month. BUT they bill it annually so whatever amount you choose is multiplied by 12 and you are charged at that time. So if you don't want to pay a minimum of $48 right away, don't waste your time bc it does NOT work properly if you choose $0. It literally didn't find any subscriptions, and absolutely no bank info at all!

So easy to use and set up your budgets and keep track of each individual expenditure. It shows you where you're over budget, where your digression or progression has been in the past., I absolutely love it and I love the ability to track everything, they even offer services like lowering your bills, your phone, your insurance, your mortgage etc. In fact I love it so much I decided to pay for the subscription, that's how much I love it, I never pay for a subscriptions even for entertainment.

edit**Several months later and I still can not link my bank account. I delete and reinstall the app and nothing. So frustrating. I have yet to finda suitable alternative either.** I've had the premium service for over 2 years and used the app for 3 and have gotten great use of it until recently. I received a notification that my bank account got disconnected and have had no success in re-linking it. Even after reading the tutorials and contacting support. After 2 weeks of not being successful,
data.replyText:
Hi Crystal,

DJ from Rocket Money here! Thanks for raising this to our attention! I'll be happy to look into this for you and make it right!

Please email me at DJ@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you to make sure you get the most use of the app!

Thanks so much!

data.text: [Edit] I talked with a rep and even though I do understand what happened now, I'm not happy. Basically I agreed to a bill negotiation back in TrueBill and ended up being set up for auto-negotiation without my knowledge. Years later they negotiated a saving and charged me $48 out of nowhere, but because I had "auto-negotiation" on, I guess technically I agreed to it. Even though I forgot I even had the account. Also the app is buggy and you can't even use the best features anymore without premium
data.replyText:
Hi Sarah,

Thanks for reaching out! We'll be happy to take a look at this and assist you further on your bill negotiation experience! Please email us at negotiations@rocketmoney.com and we'll get right on this!

Thanks so much!

data.text: Rocket money said they would renegotiate my Internet bill if they could have half the money I saved every month, which sounded great. However, they want $60 upfront for having saved me $10 per month, and my Internet bill doesn't look any smaller! When I questioned them about it, they said it might take 2 billing cycles for me to see a discount, but they're taking my $60 right now. They have absolutely nothing to show to prove that they reduced my bill at all.
data.replyText:
Hi there,

Thanks for reaching out! We'll be happy to take a look at this and assist you further on your bill negotiation experience! Please email us at negotiations@rocketmoney.com and we'll get right on this!

Thanks so much!

data.text: Used the free version 7 times in a 4 day period. I liked what I was seeing. Then I found out that they charged me $60 for the premium version. Unlike rocket mortgage, rocket money has terrible live support. I could not cancel this charge. In a chat bot they said they would cancel it next year but this premium charge stands as is. I hate automatic renewals, for that reason I caution you , the app really seems good ,but too many signs that show they are not customer friendly.
data.replyText:
Hi John,

DJ from Rocket Money here! Thanks for bringing this to our attention. I'll be happy to get it cancelled and refunded!

Please email me at DJ@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: One of the best apps in it's class! Identifies all your subscriptions and handles cancellation for you. Identifies recurring bills and offers to negotiate a lower price where possible. App is easy to use, intuative, and reporting is fantastic! One of the biggest edges this app has over many others is its ease to setup transaction categorization rules, grouping and filtering. It's Quicken...minus the complication. I rarely post raving reviews about any app, but this is one is exceptional.

Also been using since it was Truebill, and it's been more than worth it--if only for the assistance provided in finding & cancelling subscriptions. It's the only ADHD-friendly financial management app/service I've managed to stick with thus far. || **EDIT**: Dropped to three stars; it's still great to track spending, but the lack of a homescreen widget for seeing your accounts at a glance (without having to open the app) is a glaring oversight. It's the one thing that I still used from Mint.

I come from Mint as a new user since they're shutting down. I need a replacement and this was mentioned by a few users on Reddit. Rocket Money was easy enough to set up, but none of my 401ks and my mortgage provider can be connected. Budgets only work on the app, no web version. I expected more from a $10/m paid subscription, especially coming from a free product that was...frankly better. Until I can connect all my accounts, this rating won't change because it doesn't deserve anything higher.
data.replyText:
Hi Gabriel,

DJ from Rocket Money here! Thanks for raising this to our attention! I'll be happy to look into this for you and make it right, as well as refund any recent premium charge!

Please email me at DJ@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: Another Mint user jumping ship. I'm using the free option. I just need it to track my spending and savings, which is what RM provides. This is pretty similar, the only downsides of the free version is it auto-syncs info only once a day, no custom categories, no manual transaction entry, and you don't get access to net worth, goals, or credit score. Also, budgeting is limited to 4 groups, and i don't think it tracks credit card due dates.

Loved til it couldnt support my main bank account. Set up is nice and price isn't too expensive considering its hard to budget. They changed something and Plaid I think won't permit Rocket to access certain accounts. So my bank account and another investment account wouldn't sync or show up in my budget. Really inconvienent, when you're looking for an app to consolidate your finances. Would rate 5/5 if it synced, so its a great idea!!
data.replyText:
Sorry to hear about the connection issues Hannah!

Please send our support team an email to DJ@rocketmoney.com and we can have our bank linking team take a closer look.

Thanks!

data.text: Edit: None of the tracking works properly. The due dates for my bills are all messed up. I'll receive low-balance notifications almost a whole week after it goes below the threshold. The app does nothing useful for me, so I deleted my account. Decent for tracking spending, but the budgeting feature is a useless headache. I'm better off with an excel spreadsheet
data.replyText:
Hi there,

DJ from Rocket Money here! So sorry for the inconvenience! If you do happen to get our app again, I'll be happy to take a look and get this resolved for you.

Please email me at DJ@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: I like it pretty well, but I feel like I'm mostly stuck here because of sunk cost in perfecting my data. Plaid seems to have quit syncing with fidelity, which is not the devs fault but still annoying. My main gripe is that there is no option to create and track savings goals, eg I want to save $x per month in order to have $y by z/zz/zz. There are other apps for this, but it seems an app that already knows everything about my finances could provide this.
data.replyText:
Hi Alexa,

Thank you for reaching out about this!

Our app was experiencing a bug which caused this to happen which will be resolved by end of today (2/24/23).

If you have any questions, please email membersupport@rocketmoney.com and we'll be happy to assist you further.

Thanks so much!

data.text: I tried out the app, and it wasn't really what I was looking for. I ended having an issue with being charged for premium when I hadn't signed up for it. But customer service reached out to me and made it right in less than 24 hours. I've changed my review to 4 stars because of the amazing customer service. So as you look around for budgeting apps, know that this one is an A+ in that area.

Love the app. Forecasts what's ahead if in a tight spot. Let's you set a detailed budget by creating your own categories. Can set rules for what vendors go to what part of budget. For low cost of $9 per month on paid version gives your total net worth. Syncs to bank, credit cards, and loans to get accurate snapshot of financial health. Tried Mint, and I put this one (Rocket Money) on top! I have developed numerous advanced spreadsheets over the years to balance costs. This app is powerful!

Used Mint for years. I just switched and I'm not even mad about paying $4/month (yearly charge). This app is super functional - you can create rules for specific transaction amounts, and make a budget that accounts for weird transaction names and other things that Mint didn't do. You can try it out on the free mode, or 7 day trial, and then can choose what you want to pay for subscription (lowest is $6/mo, then $48/year).

Mint is shutting down so I've been looking for another budgeting app. There is a learning curve with this one compared to mint. After three days I decided to purchase a subscription. It's a good app with needed improvements. I would like to customize my dashboard, recurring, and spending tabs. I would also like budget bars so I can see spending as the month processes. They have something similar but I guess I'm accustomed to the way mint did it with red, yellow, green bars. Good mint alternative
data.replyText:
Hi Jaramaine,

DJ from Rocket Money here! Welcome and thank you so much for choosing Rocket Money! I'd love to work with you one-on-one and help you with our features as well as provide you with free premium.

Please email me at DJ@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: The app is pretty unusable on the free version. It's really clunky and hard to use. All the features that would make it useful are behind a expensive paywall. The free version is so bad I really really doubt the paid version is worth your money. When I talk to support their only suggestion is to use the "free trial" or switch to the paid version. I had this app a year ago and it was bad. I redownloaded it hoping they had fixed it and it's still really bad.
data.replyText:
Hi Landon,

DJ from Rocket Money here! Thanks for bringing this to my attention! I'll be happy to look into the issues you're experiencing as well as provide you with free premium!

Please email me at DJ@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: Great concept, horrific execution. It doesn't add up all of my bills in the budget, even though I label them as bills. The app always crashes whenever I'm trying to create a budget or if I try to negotiate any bills. Seems like it would be a great app if it did any of the things it says it does. Really disappointed this doesn't work, seems like it would've been cool.
data.replyText:
Sorry to hear about the trouble Matthew!

Please reach out to our support team via chat or email at DJ@rocketmoney.com and we can take a closer look at the issues here.

Thanks!

data.text: Love, love, love rocket money. Was a big Mint user, and this is the next evolution of that. The connector to the financial institutions is rock solid, and the categories the transactions get sorted into make sense and are easy to manage. They even got a couple of recurring charges I forgot I had cancelled for me. I just had to click 'do it's and it was done. Awesome service, and awesome app.

I've only had it for a short time, but in that time it showed me I was being double charged on my audible so I had it cancel one, the creditscore part was super useful since my credit card app showed me the same stuff but with so much less detail I couldn't figure out why it said I had x amount of credit accounts when I only had 2 credit cards, but rocket money labeled them for me apparently credit reserve lines from checking accounts also count good to know! Well see if it continues to be great

Needs an overhaul, I use it to budget it's easier to see subs and cancel stuff in one place but it doesn't update daily like it's supposed to. The only option I have to update it is to pay for the subscription. And it says that it's been out of sync for 25 days. App is fully up to date so I don't understand what's wrong. I even unlinked and relinked my bank account and it's not updating daily like it's supposed to.
data.replyText:
Hi there,

So sorry for the inconvenience! It sounds like our linking provider is having an issue with your bank. We'll be happy to look into this for you!

Please email DJ@rocketmoney.com and we'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: Entirely useless. I gave them all my data, signed up, then discovered I STILL have the pleasure of going through all my accounts, entering all the data myself, AND I get to pay for it. Best part is: the ones I did give them to try and handle? Just got an email from them saying they're "having difficulty closing my accounts". Hence, my review. This was not fast, easy, efficient or anything else they claim it to be. It was a stupid waste of time and money for a task I still need to do myself.
data.replyText:
Unfortunately, there are some companies that do not allow us to cancel on your behalf. In these cases, we provide the instructions so you're able to cancel.

We'd love to look at the issues you're experiencing with your data as well as provide you a refund for your experience. Please reach out to us at DJ@rocketmoney.com and we'll refund it!

data.text: Edit: it's been fixed! Hooray! A shame the issue happened over the weekend so it took some time for the devs to fix the problem, but I'm glad the issue was addressed and didn't take longer to fix. Also, a refund would be cool, but I'm also not paying a lot for premium so if it's not possible then that's okay. Thanks for letting your team have weekends! üíï OG post: Dashboard bug. Can't use my dashboard cause nothing is loading.
data.replyText:
Sorry to hear that Ashley,

Thankfully this was a temporary bug on our end that should be resolved.

Please force quit and reopen the app, and if you are still having trouble, send our support team an email to DJ@rocketmoney.com!

Thanks :)

data.text: Garbage. I got it to handle canceling unwanted recurring charges. Shortly after signing up I was notified of one coming up and I flagged it to cancel the subscription. A couple days later Rocket notified me of the charge!!! I canceled it myself but cannot get a refund. Pretty sure Rocket Money isn't going to pony up the 324 bucks I'm out. A thoroughly useless app and service.
data.replyText:
Sorry to hear this!

While there are some cancellations that can be completed the same day, we do notify you that cancellations can take up to 10 days.

We also cannot guarantee a refund will be provided once cancelled. Please direct any requests for a refund to the service.

Please email DJ@rocketmoney.com if you need further help with our app.

data.text: Almost perfect. I have yet to find a way to track pending checks for my checking account. (Yes, I still use a few a month.) I tried adding a manual transaction, but it is nowhere to be found after I hit save. Everything else is great. I especially like the payday view to see what I have left, but, alas, it does not include the unwashed checks.

Features are really nice, I loved that it automatically pulled my subscriptions and I found some I wasn't aware of. However, the plaid services are not linking correctly with my American Express account. It seems to unlink everyday, and asks me to re-link every time. Also, it could not pull in my Amex checking and savings account, only my credit card. If this is corrected, I would give the app 5 stars and even pay for premium. Would probably work well for anyone who doesn't use Amex for banking.
data.replyText:
Hi there,

DJ from Rocket Money here! So sorry for the inconvenience! It sounds like our linking provider is having an issue with your bank. I'll be happy to look into this for you as well as refund your premium charge.

Please email me at DJ@rocketmoney.com and I'll get right on this for you!

Thanks so much!

data.text: Really helps with keeping organized and smart money management. The app pays for itself because I easily save more per month thanks to the alerts on unused subscriptions, unusual transactions, etc. I especially love that the app will negotiate lower cell phone service bills as well as other household bills. I click a button and they do the work for me. What's not to love?

Great, would like the option to add a manual payday, as it only recognizes direct deposit. My paycheck deposits aren't shown in the upcoming with my bills. Everything else is better than the old app I had, as it added all my bills from bank history automatically without having to sign into each one manually.
